column4: is there any s/w application to write batch files that read one after one
I want to run 2-3 batch files but i want to select them at different orders
i am having a hard time understanding exactly what you are referring to, you want them to go off one at a time, at a certain time, i.e. 3pm?
not at scheduled time...but in different orders
just one after another, or after a certain command or operation in the batch file has completed?
i don;t know off hand, but let me take a crack at it.
i'm gonna see if i can find info on google
batchcomander is there but...but i am looing for something better
well, i'll do a little more research.
there is a call procedure for batch commands that might do the tricl, here's the website for it: http://www.robvanderwoude.com/call.php
i goofed up, that's for ms windows batch files, i yiy yiy.

this gives some help in bash batch calling. you would have to build a master batch file to control the others, here's where i get my info: http://nixcraft.com/shell-scripting/564-call-function-bash.html
then the proper way to call another bash script would be like this: /bin/bash /home/mylnx/script_a
